item.title: Sip into the Holidays with an Easy Iced Gingerbread Chai Latte
item.description: This iced gingerbread chai latte is the perfect festive drink. With creamy oat milk and warm spices, it's a cozy treat for chilly days. Great for holiday gatherings!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 3 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 0 minutes

â° Total Time: 3 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 1

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup oat milk
  • 1 chai tea bag
  • 1 tablespoon gingerbread syrup
  • Ice cubes
  • Optional: whipped cream for topping

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Brew the chai tea bag in a cup of hot water for about 3 minutes.
  2. Remove the tea bag and let it cool slightly.
  3. In a glass, add ice cubes to your liking.
  4. Pour the brewed chai over the ice, then add the oat milk.
  5. Stir in the gingerbread syrup until well combined.
  6. Top with whipped cream if desired and a sprinkle of cinnamon.

item.title: Refreshing Iced Vanilla Chai Latte for Hot Days
item.description: This Easy Iced Vanilla Chai Latte is your new go-to drink for warm afternoons. It combines spiced chai tea with creamy milk and a splash of vanilla for a delightful treat. Perfect for sipping while relaxing at home!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 5 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 5 minutes

â° Total Time: 10 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 2

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups brewed chai tea, cooled
  • 1 cup milk (dairy or non-dairy)
  • 2 tablespoons vanilla syrup
  • Ice cubes
  • Ground cinnamon for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Brew your chai tea according to package instructions and let it cool.
  2. In a tall glass, add ice cubes to fill halfway.
  3. Pour in the cooled chai tea, followed by the milk.
  4. Add the vanilla syrup and stir gently to combine.
  5. Sprinkle a pinch of ground cinnamon on top for an extra touch.

item.title: Iced Gingerbread Oatmilk Chai: A Cozy Starbucks Copycat
item.description: This Iced Gingerbread Oatmilk Chai is a delightful twist on a Starbucks favorite. It's creamy, spiced, and perfect for a cozy afternoon pick-me-up or a festive treat!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 5 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 0 minutes

â° Total Time: 5 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 1

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup oat milk
  • 1 chai tea bag
  • 1 tablespoon gingerbread syrup
  • Ice cubes
  • Ground cinnamon for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Brew the chai tea bag in a cup of hot water for about 5 minutes, then remove the bag.
  2. In a tall glass, add ice cubes to your desired level.
  3. Pour in the brewed chai tea, followed by the oat milk.
  4. Stir in the gingerbread syrup until well combined.
  5. Sprinkle a pinch of ground cinnamon on top for that extra festive touch.

item.title: Meal Prep Magic: Fresh and Nutritious Recipes for Busy Lives
item.description: Need quick meals for a busy week? These vibrant meal prep recipes are loaded with fresh veggies, lean proteins, and whole grains. Great for keeping your energy up during hectic days. Save this for your next meal prep session!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups quinoa, rinsed and drained
  • 1 pound chicken breast, cubed
  • 1 red bell pepper, diced
  • 1 zucchini, sliced
  • 1 cup broccoli florets
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  • 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. First, cook the quinoa. In a medium pot, combine 2 cups of water and quinoa. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and let simmer for about 15 minutes until water is absorbed.
  2. While the quinoa is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Toss in the cubed chicken, sprinkle with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for about 7-10 minutes until the chicken is browned and cooked through.
  3. Add the diced red bell pepper, zucchini, and broccoli to the skillet. SautÃ© for another 5-7 minutes until veggies are tender but still crisp.
  4. Once the quinoa is done, fluff it with a fork and mix in the lemon juice and chopped parsley. This adds a fresh kick!
  5. Divide the quinoa among meal prep containers, top with the chicken and veggies mixture, and let cool before sealing.
